alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Helena Valley; Missouri Headwaters; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, northwestern Broadwater and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered around Montana City, or 14 miles southeast of Helena. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, Townsend, Boulder, East Helena, Montana City, Wickes, Alhambra, Corbin, Spring Meadow Lake State Park, Elkhorn State Park, Winston, Silos, Clancy and Jefferson City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
